intro: Gossypium latifolium f. cearense, commonly known as the Ceará cotton plant, is a unique variant of the species native to Brazil. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and produces fluffy, white fibers similar to those of other cotton species. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its botanical significance lies in its genetic diversity and potential for agricultural use. However, it is less commonly cultivated compared to other cotton varieties due to its specific environmental requirements.
